user_completion_signals.last_user_message: i munched on a clif bar around 4 p.m. and some kettle corn while watching a show.

metadata.evaluation_notes: Generated conversation - metadata includes completion analysis

messages.content: Hi there! I'm The Seed Oil Sleuth. If you don’t mind, let’s go meal-by-meal so I can help spot any sneaky seed oils. What did breakfast look like today?
Breakfast was pretty basic—just coffee and a bagel.
Got it. Was the bagel plain, or did you add anything like butter, cream cheese, or a spread?
Uh, a little cream cheese. Nothing fancy.
Thanks. Let’s move to lunch. Where did you eat and what did you have?
I grabbed a chicken sandwich from the deli near my office.
Deli sandwiches can hide seed oils in a few spots. Do you remember if the chicken was grilled there or pre-made? And what came on the sandwich—like sauces or sides?
They grill it on-site, I think. It had lettuce, tomato, and some mayo. Came with a small bag of Lay’s.
Good to know. Restaurant grills often use canola or soybean oil, and mayo is typically soybean-oil based. The Lay’s are also fried in vegetable oils. How about dinner?
Honestly, I was tired, so I ordered stir-fry from a Thai spot—chicken, veggies, rice.
Most Thai take-outs use soybean or canola oil in the wok. Did you add any sauces or condiments at home—maybe extra soy sauce or sriracha?
Just a couple packets of soy sauce they tossed in the bag.
Understood. Any snacks between meals or after dinner?
I munched on a Clif Bar around 4 p.m. and some kettle corn while watching a show.
